Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by:  FATHER JAMES P. HAYES, St. Andrews R.C. Church, Cardinal Hayes Place, New York, NY  10007.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by COUNCIL MEMBER FREED.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Father James P. Hayes, St. Andrews R.C. Church, Cardinal Hayes Place, New York, N.Y.  10007.

Council Member Freed moved  that the invocation be spread in full upon the Minutes and adopted.

By Council Member Spigner:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Review Procedure Application Number 2000478 PPQ shall be subject to review by the Council.

By The Speaker (Council Member Vallone):
Pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council and Section 20-225(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Transportation approving an enclosed sidewalk cafe located at 35-02 Ditmars Boulevard, Astoria, New York  11105, d/b/a Ditmars Corner, Community Board #1 (20005311 TCQ), shall be subject to review by the Council.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Rules, Privileges, and Elections

Report of the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections approving the reappointment by the Mayor of ALEXANDER GARVIN as a member of the City Planning Commission.

The Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections which referred to on August 23, 2000, respectfully,

REPORTS

Pursuant to Section 31 and Section 192(a) of the New York City Charter, the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections, hereby approves the reappointment by the Mayor of ALEXANDER GARVIN as a member of the City Planning Commission, for the remainder of a term which will expire on June 30, 2004.

Res. No. 1546

RESOLUTION APPROVING THE REAPPOINTMENT BY THE MAYOR OF  ALEXANDER GARVIN AS A MEMBER OF THE CITY PLANNING COMMISSION 

By Council Member Povman

RESOLVED, that purusnat to Section 31 and Section 192(a) of the New York City Charter, the Council does hereby approve the reappointment by the Mayor of ALEXANDER GARVIN, as a member of the City Planning Commission for the remainder of a term which will expire on June 30, 2004.
Items.MatterName: City Planning Commission,  Alexander D. Garvin

Items.Title:
Report of the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections approving the reappointment by the Public Advocate of AMANDA M. BURDEN as a member of the City Planning Commission.

The Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections which referred to on August 23, 2000, respectfully,

REPORTS

Pursuant to Section 31 and Section 192(a) of the New York City Charter, the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections, hereby approves the reappointment by the Public Advocate of AMANDA M. BURDEN as a member of the City Planning Commission, for the remainder of a term which will expire on June 30, 2005.

Res. No. 1547

RESOLUTION APPROVING THE REAPPOINTMENT BY THE PUBLIC ADVOCATE OF AMANDA M. BURDEN AS A MEMBER OF THE CITY PLANNING COMMISSION

By Council Member Povman

RESOLVED, that purusnat to Section 31 and Section 192(a) of the New York City Charter, the Council does hereby approve the reappointment by the Public Advocate of AMANDA M. BURDEN, as a member of the City Planning Commission for the remainder of a term which will expire on June 30, 2005.
Items.MatterName: City Planning Commission, Amanda M. Burden

Items.MatterName: Base Station License, Disapproval, Cadman Express Car & Limo, Brooklyn

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring that official reports issued by the city and its agencies, the Council, the Office of the Public Advocate and the Office of the Comptroller be made available to the public by the world wide web on the city’s web site.
Items.MatterName: Office reports be made available on city's web site.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the regulation of outdoor advertising and repealing subdivision 10 of section 26-126.4 of such code in relation thereto

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increasing the penalties for persons who have been previously convicted three or more times of illegal consumption of alcohol on city streets.
Items.MatterName: Consumption of Alcohol on City Streets.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the members of the New York State Legislature to amend the penal law by creating a class C felony for entering or remaining in any school or house of worship with the intent to commit a crime therein.
Items.MatterName: Committing crime in any school or house of worship, Class C felony.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the members of the New York State Legislature to amend the Penal Law by creating a class E felony for stealing money from any house of worship.
Items.MatterName: Stealing money from any house of worship, Class E Felony

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting the operation, standing or parking of mobile billboards.
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring sight-seeing buses to operate on alternative fuel.
Items.MatterName: Requiring Sight-seeing buses to use alternative fuel.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to authorizing the commissioner of consumer affairs to require that the engines of sight-seeing buses comply with emission standards as a condition of licensing.
Items.MatterName: Sight-seeing buses comply with emissions standards.

Items.MatterName: Name Change, Pat Mazzoli Way, Brooklyn

Items.MatterName: MTA, 2nd Subway Entrance at Ave. A & 14th Street

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon DHCR to withdraw their recently proposed rule changes and reinitiate the process of drafting rules with the input of tenants, and calling upon the Governor to order DHCR to do so.
Items.MatterName: DHCR to withdraw proposed rule changes.
